issue.title: Using spacenav to control arm can interfere with UserCamera control

content.raw: left button of the spacenav should toggle camera control. Does that resolve this issue?
content.html: left button of the spacenav should toggle camera control. Does that resolve this issue?

issue.title: Using spacenav to control arm can interfere with UserCamera control

content.raw:
Pasting the discussion:

Jackie:

Looks good. However, the major issue is that when the user switches into viewpoint control by pressing the left spacenav button, both the viewpoint and the arm respond to spacenav messages. That can be fixed in a later pull request, but it should definitely be addressed (especially if we advertise Spacenav viewpoint control as a feature).

Steve:

This is an excellent point. Sorry for not mentioning it in the description of the pull request. I thought of two options for dealing with this issue, which I will describe below. I didn't like either one, so I haven't implemented them yet.

* Currently the plugin listens to the default spacenav topic `~/user_camera/joy_twist`, which is the same as the viewpoint controller. The conflict could be avoided by disabling the spacenav viewport control by telling this plugin to listen to a different topic and specifying a different spacenav topic in the gui.ini file.
* We could also try to match the button logic from UserCamera.cc (see pull request #1249). I don't like this idea because the plugin and viewport could get out of sync if one of them misses a message. Also, it's basically putting logic in two places that would need to stay in sync.
content.html:
Pasting the discussion:

Jackie:

Looks good. However, the major issue is that when the user switches into viewpoint control by pressing the left spacenav button, both the viewpoint and the arm respond to spacenav messages. That can be fixed in a later pull request, but it should definitely be addressed (especially if we advertise Spacenav viewpoint control as a feature).

Steve:

This is an excellent point. Sorry for not mentioning it in the description of the pull request. I thought of two options for dealing with this issue, which I will describe below. I didn't like either one, so I haven't implemented them yet.

  • Currently the plugin listens to the default spacenav topic ~/user_camera/joy_twist, which is the same as the viewpoint controller. The conflict could be avoided by disabling the spacenav viewport control by telling this plugin to listen to a different topic and specifying a different spacenav topic in the gui.ini file.
  • We could also try to match the button logic from UserCamera.cc (see pull request #1249). I don't like this idea because the plugin and viewport could get out of sync if one of them misses a message. Also, it's basically putting logic in two places that would need to stay in sync.

issue.title: Using spacenav to control arm can interfere with UserCamera control

content.raw: I think the issue is that you can't use the spacenav to control the user camera without affecting the arm.
content.html: I think the issue is that you can't use the spacenav to control the user camera without affecting the arm.

issue.title: Using spacenav to control arm can interfere with UserCamera control

content.raw: There is a workaround, but it does disable an existing gazebo feature. Hence the minor priority
content.html: There is a workaround, but it does disable an existing gazebo feature. Hence the minor priority
